title: Absolute minimum of a function on closed interval

content.question: The function g is given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mn>4</mn> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msup> <mo>+</mo> <mn>3</mn> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>−</mo> <mn>6</mn> <mi>x</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4876@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. What is the absolute minimum value of g on the closed interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>[</mo> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mo>,</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> <mo>]</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E41@</annotation> </semantics> </math>?

topic.text: 5.5: Using the Candidates Test to Determine Absolute (Global) Extrema

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
